title.native: 戦翼のシグルドリーヴァ

description:
When the Pillars suddenly appear on Earth, threatening all life, it's only the act of the god Odin that offers humanity salvation. Providing a means of fighting back, he gives Earth the Valkyries, young female pilots with supernatural powers and spirit fighter planes. These skilled troublemakers, all young, risk their lives in a long-running war—but the final battle is fast approaching!

(Source: Funimation)

Note: The first episode aired with a runtime of ~48 minutes.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yamibun)

A freelance writer who specialises in military and historical research. He graduated from Hokkaido University's Department of Literature and Philosophy.

His most important work was the multimedia project Strike Witches, for which he provided military and world research aide as well as penned scripts for the anime series and wrote lyrics for several related songs. His other works include short novel stories for various magazines, like MC Axis, two currently serialised manga series with Tsuki no Umi no Rua (Young King Ours) and Sailor Fuku to Juusensha (Champion Red Ichigo) and several doujin works. He did also write scripts and was SF aide for the Gonzo anime series Last Exile, Witchblade, GunXSword and Solty Rei.

He is member of the doujin circle Firstspear.

(Source: Anidb)

__[Profile (F.M.F Corporation)](http://www.fmf-music.com/creators2.html#id69)__ | __[Blog (JP)](http://sk55.seesaa.net/)__

__Birthplace:__ Takayama City, Gifu Prefecture, Japan
__Favorite Artists:__ Brian Eno, Coldcut, Miles Davis

__Shigeo Komori__ is a Japanese keyboardist, music producer, composer and arranger.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ohkowai/status/1446500402275373056)

Takumi Yokota is an animator and character designer that is currently freelance. He was formerly affiliated with ufotable, Anime International Company (AIC), and Shaft.

After graduating from university from the Faculty of Law department, he joined ufotable as a production assistant. He stated in an interview with Akiba Souken in 2019, that while watching movies and anime at the library in his third or fourth year of job hunting, he fell in love with the work Patlabor: The Mobile Police, directed by Mamoru Oshii. And while watching Oshii's interview, he decided that he wanted to become a director, and when he was researching on how to become a director, he found out that one of the paths of becoming a director is by starting out as a production assistant; and so he applied as a production assistant at ufotable. He later left ufotable due to various reasons and described himself as a NEET for almost half a year after departing from ufotable. After more than three months of being a NEET, he thought to himself that he really needed to get a job, and then remembered his time as a production assistant at ufotable. While still working as a production assistant at ufotable, a conversation with an animator at ufotable stuck with him, and thought subsequently: "Let's go back to anime again!" And in 2007, he applied as an animator at Anime International Company (AIC) when he saw that the studio was hiring 20 new animators, and got the position. He made his debut as an animator with 2007's Tokyo Majin, co-animated by AIC Spirits and BeSTACK. He has stated that while at his time at the studio, AIC took care of its animators well so that they could live, and was occasionally treated by his seniors at the studio. He cites Ryuichi Makino as one of his mentors while at AIC. In 2011, he made his debut as an animation director in 2011, with AIC's adaptation of R-15 of the same name. In 2013, he made his character designer debut with Pupipo!, animated by AIC PLUS+. In 2014, he left AIC and became an animator at Shaft. As of December 2019, he has become freelance.

__[Website](https://spiraspica.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/spiraspica) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/spiraspica/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCcrVKHnn9O3z0Ao6sUPE7nA)__

__Formed:__ 2013
__Genres:__ J-POP, Rock (Pop Rock)

__Introduction:__
Spira Spica is a Japanese three-piece pop rock band under record labels Tower Records and Sacra Music (2018–), affiliated with the entertainment office Sony Music Artists.

__Biography:__
The band initially formed and began activities in 2013 under the name Snowman. Originally the band only consisted of childhood friends Yuuji and Masuda, but they were later joined by the vocalist Mikiha, who had initially heard of the band after they announced they were looking for a female vocalist.

On January 6, 2018, the band announced they would change their band name from Snowman to Spira Spica, which they have used since.

__Members:__
- [Mikiha](https://anilist.co/staff/169459) (幹葉) – vocalist, in-charge of lyrics
- Yuuji Teranishi (寺西裕二) – guitarist
- Masuda (ますだ) – bassist

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ohkowai/status/1446500402275373056)

Takumi Yokota is an animator and character designer that is currently freelance. He was formerly affiliated with ufotable, Anime International Company (AIC), and Shaft.

After graduating from university from the Faculty of Law department, he joined ufotable as a production assistant. He stated in an interview with Akiba Souken in 2019, that while watching movies and anime at the library in his third or fourth year of job hunting, he fell in love with the work Patlabor: The Mobile Police, directed by Mamoru Oshii. And while watching Oshii's interview, he decided that he wanted to become a director, and when he was researching on how to become a director, he found out that one of the paths of becoming a director is by starting out as a production assistant; and so he applied as a production assistant at ufotable. He later left ufotable due to various reasons and described himself as a NEET for almost half a year after departing from ufotable. After more than three months of being a NEET, he thought to himself that he really needed to get a job, and then remembered his time as a production assistant at ufotable. While still working as a production assistant at ufotable, a conversation with an animator at ufotable stuck with him, and thought subsequently: "Let's go back to anime again!" And in 2007, he applied as an animator at Anime International Company (AIC) when he saw that the studio was hiring 20 new animators, and got the position. Originating from [Artland](https://anilist.co/studio/8/). Currently freelance with ties to [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/).
